fields.description:
*Eucalyptus Version*

{{4.3.0-0.25084.394.20160830git660153b.el7}}

*Assessment*

After launching an instance with monitoring enabled, the cloudwatch metrics associated with that instance took over 30 minutes to display.
{code}
## instance launched at 2016-10-25T15:58:24.391Z ##
[root@g-22-04 ~]# euca-describe-instances --region sales-admin@
RESERVATION	r-62f89610	002598321247	InstanceTest-SecurityGroup-26WVRONOKACZV
INSTANCE	i-45dcd802	emi-d978f0ca	euca-10-116-155-247.eucalyptus.b-29.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com	euca-10-0-0-31.eucalyptus.internal	running	sales-admin	0m1.medium	2016-10-25T15:58:24.391Z	ds2				monitoring-enabled	10.116.155.247	10.0.0.31	vpc-3372be7e	subnet-8c40de95	instance-store		hvm			sg-2464f50f				x86_64
NETWORKINTERFACE	eni-aeeda534	subnet-8c40de95	vpc-3372be7e	002598321247	in-use	10.0.0.31	euca-10-0-0-31.eucalyptus.internal	true
ATTACHMENT		eni-attach-e600891e	0	attached	2016-10-25T15:58:24.969Z	true
ASSOCIATION	10.116.155.247	002598321247	10.0.0.31
GROUP	sg-2464f50f	InstanceTest-SecurityGroup-26WVRONOKACZV
PRIVATEIPADDRESS	10.0.0.31	euca-10-0-0-31.eucalyptus.internal	primary
TAG	instance	i-45dcd802	Application	arn:aws:cloudformation::002598321247:stack/InstanceTest/24bce0ed-2838-4ff4-b2f1-acfd3800c3be
TAG	instance	i-45dcd802	aws:cloudformation:logical-id	Instance
TAG	instance	i-45dcd802	aws:cloudformation:stack-id	arn:aws:cloudformation::002598321247:stack/InstanceTest/24bce0ed-2838-4ff4-b2f1-acfd3800c3be
TAG	instance	i-45dcd802	aws:cloudformation:stack-name	InstanceTest

## example of failed euwatch-list-metrics ##

[root@g-22-04 ~]# euwatch-list-metrics --region euca-admin@
[root@g-22-04 ~]# date -u
Tue Oct 25 16:26:06 UTC 2016
[root@g-22-04 ~]# euwatch-list-metrics --region euca-admin@
[root@g-22-04 ~]#

## euwatch-list-metrics failed to display metrics until the time below ##

[root@g-22-04 ~]# date -u
Tue Oct 25 17:34:35 UTC 2016
[root@g-22-04 ~]# euwatch-list-metrics --region sales-admin@

*Signs*

I checked the DB to confirm that the stats were there.  For whatever reason, the metrics were not displayed for any of the {{euwatch-list-metrics}} calls:
{code}

*Steps*

# Use linked {{cfn-instance-test.json}} template to deploy stack on Eucalyptus VPC cloud using Ubuntu cloud image 16.04 LTS (Xenial Xerus):
{code}
[root@g-22-04 ~]# euform-create-stack InstanceTest --template-file cfn-instance-test.json --parameter ImageId=emi-d978f0ca --parameter KeyName=sales-admin --region sales-admin@
arn:aws:cloudformation::002598321247:stack/InstanceTest/24bce0ed-2838-4ff4-b2f1-acfd3800c3be
{code}
# Confirm stack deploys:
{code}
[root@g-22-04 ~]# euform-describe-stacks --region sales-admin@

NETWORKINTERFACE	eni-aeeda534	subnet-8c40de95	vpc-3372be7e	002598321247	in-use	10.0.0.31	euca-10-0-0-31.eucalyptus.internal	true

TAG	instance	i-45dcd802	aws:cloudformation:stack-name	InstanceTest
{code}
# Wait about 5 minutes (per [AWS recommendations|http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonCloudWatch/latest/monitoring/US_SingleMetricPerInstance.html]), then use {{euwatch-list-metrics}} to see  if metrics are displayed
fields.summary: CloudWatch metrics take a long time (over 30 minutes) to display data
fields.environment: Federated cloud - environment YAMLs for both clouds are listed in the comments

comments.body:
The issue on the qa cloud I looked at was that the resourceUuid is not set in some cases in the describe sensors response which causes processing for all resources (instances) to fail:

{code}
      <n:sensorsResources>
        <n:resourceName>i-78712344</n:resourceName>
        <n:resourceType>instance</n:resourceType>
        <n:resourceUuid/>
        <n:metrics>
          <n:metricName>CPUUtilization</n:metricName>
{code}

After talking with [~ethomas], looks like there are two issues here to fix:
{quote}
11:50 ethomas_: there might be two fixes here.  1) make sure cc/nc doesn't send empty uuid,  2) just ignore empty uuid at the CLC
11:51 ethomas_: If I do 2, we can pull in code to the setup you have, otherwise it might be hard to reproduce if fixed.
12:33 h-rock: k
12:33 h-rock: yea, i will keep that setup there
{quote}

Hey [~ethomas],

I attempted to reproduce this after EUCA-12968 was fixed.  I didn't get the ~30 minute behavior.  It did take ~15 minutes for the metrics to show up (via {{euwatch-list-metrics}}). Is this behavior intended?  If so, maybe we should create a doc ticket to inform users regarding how this behavior differs from AWS Cloudwatch?  I attached the 'results.txt' file from my test.  My test, I launched an instance with monitoring enabled.  I think used the 'watch' command to append data returned from {{euwatch-list-metrics}} for the given instance ID.  Let me know if you need me to provide additional information.

*Setup*

Cloud - [hspencer-257|http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Maint-4.3/257/] [^results.txt]

[~hspencer]  Yes, this is the default behavior (~15 minutes or so).  The properties used to determine how frequently data is returned from the back end are cloud.monitor.default_poll_interval_mins (set to 5 by default) and cloud.monitor.history_size (set to 5 by default).  This combination describes both the frequency and number of data points returned.  I believe they return data for every 5 minutes.  And given that you need at least two data points from the back end to create a single data point in cloudwatch, together with the fact that list metrics also runs once every 5 minutes could easily give you your 15 minute number.  This is default/expected behavior.  Should I close the bug?

I opened a doc ticket with default behavior,   here:

https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/browse/DOC-2038
